title: Culture: Household (Usefulness 1-5)
description: Traveler usefulness 1-5/10 phrases for the Household subcategory within Culture. Includes 5 card(s).

cards.english: The family Buddhist altar is traditionally an essential and spiritual center of a Japanese family.
cards.romaji: Butsudan wa, furukukara nihon no katei ni oite ch shintekina sonzai deshita.
cards.japanese: 仏壇は、古くから日本の家庭において中心的な存在でした。

cards.english: A typical image of winter in Japan is a family sitting around a "kotatsu" eating mandarin oranges.
cards.romaji: nihon no tenkeitekina fuyu no im.ji wa, kazokuga kotatsu o kakonde mikan o taberu y.su desu.
cards.japanese: 日本の典型的な冬のイメージは、家族がこたつを囲んでみかんを食べる様子です。

cards.english: The most common type of miniature altar has a miniature shrine with a talisman inside it, which is called a "fudamiya".
cards.romaji: kamidana no ichiban ippantekina katachi wa, ofuda o nakani osameru, "fudamiya" to y kamidana desu.
cards.japanese: 神棚の一番一般的な形は、お札を中に収める、「札宮」という神棚です。

cards.english: The area of a room in Japan is often described by the number of tatami mats it contains, such as "6 tatami mats" for a room measuring around 9.9 square metres.
cards.romaji: nihon dewa, oyoso ky ten ky heih. m.toru no heya o "roku j." to arawasu y.ni, heya no .kisa o tatami no kazu de arawashimasu.
cards.japanese: 日本では、およそ九点九平方メートルの部屋を「六畳」と表すように、部屋の大きさを畳の数で表します。

cards.english: After taking your shoes off at the entrance, the shoes should be lined up neatly with the toes pointing towards the front door.
cards.romaji: genkan de kutsu o nuida ato wa, tsumasaki ga doa no h. o mukuy.ni soroemasu.
cards.japanese: 玄関で靴を脱いだ後は、つま先がドアの方向を向くように揃えます。
